course_title: French Language and Culture 1: ex beginners

learning_outcomes.description: perform designated cultural practices through the reuse of linguistic and non-verbal behaviour studied in the course
deploy strategies for intercultural communication in French
describe, in French, differences and similarities between French-speaking cultures and others which you know
deploy knowledge about France and in particular (although not exclusively) life as a student
apply the rules of French grammar and pronunciation to the set tasks
read/ listen to texts in French critically for what they say, explicitly and implicitly, about cultural difference
read critically authentic texts in French with an understanding of their linguistic, cultural and historical content

assessments.due_date:
15/04/2026

13/05/2026

Week 7. In-semester school-based examination held in the Wednesday tutorial class. The exam is scheduled to start at 8am.

Week 11. In-semester school-based examination held in the Wednesday tutorial class. The exam is scheduled to start at 8am.
assessments.task_description:
Writing Task 1: la lettre formelle (20%)

This assessment consists of a school-based in-class test in the second tutorial of Week 7 at 8am, during which students will write a formal letter from the point of view of an overseas student at a French university wishing to bring some concerns to the attention of the relevant authorities. Students will be required to use and adapt a number of set structures in the lettre formelle.

Perusal time : 10 minutes

Exam duration : 60 minutes

200-250 words (not including the date and addresses).

Use of Generative AI & MT: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

Writing Task 2: le récit autobiographique interculturel (20%)

This assessment consists of a school-based in class test in the second tutorial of Week 11 at 8am. For this task, you will write an essay in which you recount a personal intercultural experience and reflect on it. You will be obliged to use a certain number of structures which will only be revealed in the in-class exam.

Perusal time : 10 minutes

Exam duration : 60 minutes

300-400 words

Use of Generative AI & MT: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
Part 1: Au revoir les enfants - 26/03/2026 - 28/04/2026

Part 2: Kiffe kiffe demain - 7/05/2026 - 28/05/2026

The presentations will take place during class time. Students will sign up on Blackboard to the presentation of a specific extract of the set texts on specific dates. The student's assigned timeslot will be considered the due date and time for this assessment.
assessments.task_description:
Au revoir les enfants (Weeks 5, 6, 8 and 9) Kiffe-Kiffe demain (Weeks 10, 12 and 13) (20%)

  • Students will work in pairs to present to the class a passage from Au revoir les enfants (Weeks 5, 6, 8 or 9) or Kiffe-kiffe demain (Weeks 10, 12 or 13) during which they will identify and explain moments in the text which require linguistic and cultural contextualisation. 
  • Students will select their passage from a predetermined list posted on Blackboard. 
  • 15 minutes including questions (10 minutes performance and presentation + 5 minutes for questions).
  • A PowerPoint may be used as a pedagogical aid, but with a strict limit to the number of slides and words. Please see Blackboard for more details.

Working in teams

Please note that your presentation will work best if you both work as a team. For example, you may decide to divide the presentation into sections for different team members to work on, but your presentation will be stronger if both team members have input on other's work and offer feedback and advice. This will make the overall presentation more coherent.

If a group member does not participate with the group (i.e. attending meetings, responding to messages, completing drafts in a timely manner as decided by the group, submitting work as requested), the group member may be removed from the pairing and required to complete work individually without the benefit of feedback from the other team member. It is incumbent upon team members to treat each other professionally and to report to the course coordinator if a member has been non-responsive or non-participatory. If a team member is removed from a group, they will be notified in writing by the course coordinator.

If you have circumstances which prevent you from working in a pairing, you must formally request permission to complete this assessment item individually by emailing the course coordinator before team assignments are made. Your request should include supporting documentation or refer to an SAPD or application for an extension.

Use of Generative AI & MT: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (Al) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted in the oral venue. Any attempted use of Al or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. You may however find it useful to use these tools to plan and practice for your oral, for example, looking up vocabulary, checking pronunciation, generating possible questions which you might be asked. Remember that this assessment item is about teaching your chosen extract to an audience, NOT about performing a script. The ability to participate in a conversation in French on a familiar topic is arguably one of the most important outcomes of the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
15/06/2026 - 17/06/2026

Exam Week 2. Precise dates and times will be announced on Blackboard.
assessments.task_description:
This assessment will split into two parts and is to be completed individually.

Part 1: you will give a presentation as if you were addressing French students contemplating the prospect of studying in your country. You will use a PowerPoint to help present the information, and will make limited use of notes. The PowerPoint must be submitted to Blackboard before 11.59pm the night before your presentation.

You will speak for five minutes, and the presentation will be followed by questions from the examiners.

Part 2: you will engage in a conversation with your examiners about the course content, concentrating in particular on Kiffe-kiffe demain by Faïza Guène and Au revoir les enfants by Louis Malle, as well as the social, historical and cultural context of these two texts.

Students unable to make the presentation must apply for an extension.

PLEASE NOTE : THIS PRESENTATION ORALE IS A HURDLE REQUIREMENT. STUDENTS MUST OBTAIN AT LEAST 40% ON THIS PIECE OF ASSESSMENT TO PASS THE COURSE.

Use of Generative AI & MT: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (Al) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted in the oral venue. Any attempted use of Al or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. You may however find it useful to use these tools to plan and practice for your oral, for example, looking up vocabulary, checking pronunciation, generating possible questions which you might be asked. Remember that this assessment item is about engaging with your audience during a presentation as well as participation in a conversation, NOT about performing a script. • The ability to participate in a conversation in French on a familiar topic is arguably one of the most important outcomes of the course. This importance is reflected in the fact that this is an Identity Verified Assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
